DOC.brief_title: Retroclavicular Versus Supraclavicular Brachial Plexus Block Hand Forearm Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The study propose patient undergo formarm hand surgery brachial plexus block . Patients randomize one two group The first group - supraclavicular group - receive ultrasound-guided brachial plexus block via supraclavicular approach , injection 30 ml mixture ropivacaine 0.5 % + mepivacaine 1 % . The second group - retroclavicular group - receive ultrasound-guided brachial plexus block via retroclavicular approach , injection 30 ml mixture ropivacaine 0.5 % + mepivacaine 1 % . Primary outcome success rate 30 minute injection define loss sensation pinprick forearm hand . Secondary outcome : needling time , time first analgesic request , postoperative opioid consumption , pain score 12 24 hour postoperatively , block-related complication , patient satisfaction .
DOC.criteria: Adult patient undergo forearm hand surgery brachial plexus block . History allergic reaction local anaesthetic Peripheral neuropathy Renal hepatic insufficiency Coagulation disorder
